paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: The paper reports on the TTR E61K mutation, detailing its clinical significance, penetrance data, and functional studies.

patients.demographics: 5 patients, 5 males and 2 females, Chinese Han ethnicity, mean age at onset 62 years
patients.phenotype: Hereditary transthyretin amyloidosis with symptoms including sensory-motor polyneuropathy and autonomic dysfunction.

individual_records.evidence_sentence: The average age of onset for the five patients was 62 years.

individual_records.phenotype_details: Sensory-motor polyneuropathy, autonomic dysfunction, cardiac symptoms.
individual_records.evidence_sentence: Patient 2 had significantly elevated NT-proBNP with atrial fibrillation.
All the patients had sensory-motor polyneuropathy and autonomic nerve system involvement.

individual_records.phenotype_details: Sensory-motor polyneuropathy, autonomic dysfunction, cardiac symptoms.
individual_records.evidence_sentence: Patient 4 took Vyndamax (Tafamidis) 61 mg orally once daily.
Patient 5 took diflunisal orally daily and stopped it 6 months ago.
The two asymptomatic carriers were patient 2’s 40-year-old son.
The two asymptomatic carriers were patient 4’s 35-year-old daughter.

functional_data.summary: E61K-TTR was characterized as a kinetically destabilized protein compared to WT-TTR.

variants.segregation_data: The E61K mutation segregates with disease in families.
variants.additional_notes: The study included both symptomatic patients and asymptomatic carriers.
key_quotes: The average age of onset for the five patients was 62 years.
The two asymptomatic carriers were patient 2’s 40-year-old son and patient 4’s 35-year-old daughter.

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data was extracted from the main text.
